value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kAniA_N7sB8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Differences between INT and CONVERT in DAX
value.excerpt: How do you convert a DAX expression into an integer value? There are small differences between INT and CONVERT in DAX that may end up returning different results in arithmetic expressions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/742452?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/NNwA8Iy4i84" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Different options to model many to many relationships in Power BI and Tabular
value.excerpt: There are two options to model many-to-many relationships using Tabular and Power BI: you can use either a regular bidirectional filter relationship, or a limited unidirectional relationship. In this video, we compare the performance of both options. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dEgBOsQGHBA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Distinguishing HASONEVALUE from ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: This video describes the differences between HASONEVALUE and ISINSCOPE, which are two useful DAX functions to control the filters and the grouping that are active in a report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662962?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8UNNo233eFc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/71ERlpfhmwU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZIJDv3J9kko" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Formula engine and storage engine in DAX
value.excerpt: Understanding the differences between the formula engine and the storage engine is the first step to understand the performance metrics and optimize a DAX formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684038?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hc-x4DBv0V4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fU5EQBJDfOM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing LOOKUPVALUE
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use LOOKUPVALUE, which is a handy function for any developer to have in their toolbelt. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670595?aff=yt Additional resources: Expanded tables (article): https://sql.bi/65647?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pmZ-gumL7H0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Show last 13 months based on user single slicer selection
value.excerpt: Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xZyJlgE1RsI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using calculation groups to switch between different dates
value.excerpt: Use calculation groups to change the active relationship in a model in order to let users choose among multiple dates in a Power BI report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684295?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kilQrRR04mY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX
value.excerpt: Improve DAX queries by using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS when you create table expressions. Article and video: https://sql.bi/54337?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/AieQMS6rGvM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Viva Insights (Workplace Analytics)
value.excerpt: Collaboration is a key component of knowledge-worker success. Microsoft Viva Insights (Workplace Analytics) turns Microsoft 365 data into useful insights about how organizations get work done and empowers leaders to drive strategies for positive change. Get started with Microsoft Workplace Analytics introduces how you can use Workplace Analytics to access these insights. You will learn what Workplace Analytics is and how it works, how to onboard to Workplace Analytics from the administrator perspective, how you can evaluate and track collaboration with the Ways of working assessment, and how you can use Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics to drive organizational change.

topItems.title: Analyze collaboration and engagement using the Workplace Analytics Ways of working assessment dashboard
topItems.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

topItems.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics
topItems.excerpt: After using Microsoft Workplace Analytics and Power BI to generate insights about your employees’ work behaviors, you’ll learn about the Microsoft 365 features that can be tools to implement and measure the changes you’ve identified. You’ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Workplace Analytics

Workplace Analytics turns Microsoft 365 data into useful insights about how organizations get work done and empowers leaders to drive strategies for positive change. Get started with Microsoft Workplace Analytics introduces how you can use Workplace Analytics to access these insights. You will learn what Workplace Analytics is and how it works, how to onboard to Workplace Analytics from the administrator perspective, how you can evaluate and track collaboration with the Ways of working assessment, and how you can use Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics to drive organizational change.

topItems.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

You’ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Add calculated tables and columns to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to add calculated tables and calculated columns to your data model. You'll also be able to describe row context, which is used to evaluated calculated column formulas. Because it's possible to add columns to a table using Power Query, you'll also learn when it's best to create calculated columns instead of Power Query computed columns.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Intelligent environments - Education Transformation Framework
value.excerpt: Develop safe and secure onsite and online environments. Use data analytics to optimize student outcomes and to create efficient, responsive, and sustainable processes and resources allocation.

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.

value.title: Transition from Excel to Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft's Power BI combines the Power Query's extraction, transformation, and loading capabilities with DAX and a relational data model in a new application with new features.

value.title: Automate Power BI administration
value.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Configure Power BI report filters
value.excerpt: Report filtering is a complex topic because many techniques are available for filtering a Microsoft Power BI report. However, with complexity comes control, allowing you to design reports that meet requirements and expectations.

value.title: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user interface
value.excerpt: Designing the user interface (UI) is about how reports are consumed, including the appearance and behavior of them, and it is the final report development stage.

value.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

value.title: Analyze collaboration and engagement using the Workplace Analytics Ways of working assessment dashboard
value.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.
